meanings.definition: The act of remaining upright on the feet.
meanings.sent1: Her standing in the race was strong as she crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: I lost my standing when I tripped and fell during the performance.
meanings.sent3: His standing in the dance class was wobbly as he struggled to balance on one foot.
meanings.sent4: The toddler's standing improved with practice, and soon he could walk confidently.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's perfect standing on the balance beam amazed the audience.

meanings.definition: A person's position or status in relation to others.
meanings.sent1: Her standing as the team captain earned her respect from her peers.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's standing in the company allowed him to make important decisions.
meanings.sent3: His standing as the class clown made everyone laugh during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: The professor's standing in the academic community was well-deserved due to his research contributions.
meanings.sent5: The politician's standing among voters was evident in the election results.
